semantic_title: Locating Codes Using Both Alphabetic Index and Tabular List
section_path: Section I > B. General Coding Guidelines > 1. Locating a code in the ICD-10-CM

content.full_text: To select a code in the classification that corresponds to a diagnosis or reason for visit documented in a medical record, first locate the term in the Alphabetic Index, and then verify the code in the Tabular List. Read and be guided by instructional notations that appear in both the Alphabetic Index and the Tabular List. It is essential to use both the Alphabetic Index and Tabular List when locating and assigning a code. The Alphabetic Index does not always provide the full code. Selection of the full code, including laterality and any applicable 7th character can only be done in the Tabular List. A dash (-) at the end of an Alphabetic Index entry indicates that additional characters are required. Even if a dash is not included at the Alphabetic Index entry, it is necessary to refer to the Tabular List to verify that no 7th character is required. (Evidence: pg no: 12, L76-L86)
content.summary: Essential two-step process requiring use of both Alphabetic Index and Tabular List, with Tabular List verification mandatory for complete code assignment (Evidence: pg no: 12, L76-L86)
key_concepts: Two-step process: Index then Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 12, L77-L78)
Verify code in Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 12, L78)
Read instructional notations in both (Evidence: pg no: 12, L78)
Essential to use both Index and Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 12, L79-L80)
Index does not always provide full code (Evidence: pg no: 12, L80)
Tabular List needed for laterality and 7th character (Evidence: pg no: 12, L81-L82)
Dash indicates additional characters required (Evidence: pg no: 12, L83)
Always verify 7th character requirement (Evidence: pg no: 12, L84-L86)

detailed_rules.rule_text: First locate term in Alphabetic Index, then verify code in Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 12, L77-L78)
detailed_rules.explanation: This two-step process ensures accurate code selection and complete code assignment (Evidence: pg no: 12, L77-L78)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Essential to use both Alphabetic Index and Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 12, L79-L80)
detailed_rules.explanation: Alphabetic Index alone is insufficient for complete code assignment (Evidence: pg no: 12, L80)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Always refer to Tabular List to verify 7th character requirement even without dash (Evidence: pg no: 12, L84-L86)
detailed_rules.explanation: 7th character requirements may exist even when not indicated by dash in Index (Evidence: pg no: 12, L84-L86)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Locate diagnosis term in Alphabetic Index
Step 2: Note the code provided in Index
Step 3: Go to Tabular List to verify code

code_patterns.description: Indicates additional characters required (Evidence: pg no: 12, L83)
code_patterns.explanation: Must go to Tabular List for complete code

coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Closed fracture of left femoral neck, initial encounter
step_by_step: Step 1: Look up 'Fracture, femur, neck' in Alphabetic Index
Step 2: Note code S72.00- with dash
Step 3: Go to S72.00 in Tabular List
Step 5: Add 7th character (A for initial encounter)

correct_coding.sequencing: Complete code with all required characters
correct_coding.rationale: Two-step process ensures complete code with laterality and 7th character (Evidence: pg no: 12, L81-L86)

incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using Index code without Tabular List verification

warnings: Never use Alphabetic Index alone for code assignment (Evidence: pg no: 12, L79-L80)
Always verify 7th character requirements even without dash indicator (Evidence: pg no: 12, L84-L86)
best_practices: Always use two-step process: Index then Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 12, L77-L78)
Read all instructional notations in both Index and Tabular List (Evidence: pg no: 12, L78)
common_mistakes: Using incomplete codes from Alphabetic Index only
tips: Dash in Index always means more characters needed
Even without dash, check Tabular List for 7th character
Pay attention to all instructional notes
